s2.ptxt: Inspect the torque converter clutch assembly (See page ).
Install the torque converter clutch to the automatic transmission.
Using a vernier caliper and straightedge, measure dimension A between the contact surfaces of the transmission and engine (*1), and the contact surfaces of the converter and drive plate (*2).
Using a vernier caliper and straightedge, measure dimension B shown in the illustration. Check that B is greater than A.

specitem.ptxt: B = A + 1.00 mm (0.0394 in.) or more

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL NO. 1 ENGINE MOUNTING INSULATOR REAR

s2.ptxt: Install the engine mounting insulator to the transmission with the 4 bolts.
Apply clutch spline grease to the surface of the torque converter centerpiece that contacts the crankshaft.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota Genuine Clutch Spline Grease or equivalent

s2.ptxt: Install the transmission to the engine with the 7 bolts.

atten3.ptxt: Before installing the transmission, make sure that the 2 knock pins on the engine block have not been removed.

s2.ptxt: Install the exhaust manifold stay with the 3 bolts.
Turn the crankshaft to gain access to the installation locations of the 6 torque converter clutch mounting bolts and install each bolt while holding the crankshaft pulley bolt with a wrench.

atten3.ptxt: First install the black colored bolt and then the remaining 5 bolts.

s2.ptxt: Connect the connectors.

s3.ptxt: Connect the park/neutral position switch connector.

s2.ptxt: *1: Install the frame crossmember to the engine mounting insulator with the 4 set bolts.
*2: Connect the ends of the frame crossmember to the vehicle with the 4 bolts and 4 nuts.
Install the starter with the 2 bolts.
Install the starter wire to terminal 30 with the nut.
Connect the terminal cap.
Connect the starter connector.
Install the fender seal with the 5 clips.
Install the control cable bracket with the 2 bolts.

s-1.ptxt: CONNECT TRANSMISSION CONTROL SHIFT CABLE ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Connect the control cable with the clip and nut.
Connect the end of the oil cooler tube inlet to the automatic transmission by hand.
Connect the end of the oil cooler tube outlet to the automatic transmission by hand.
Install the 3 clamps with the 3 bolts.
Using a union nut wrench, tighten the inlet and outlet tubes.

item.ptxt: Use a torque wrench with a fulcrum length of 300 mm (11.8 in.).
The torque value for use with a union nut wrench is effective when the union nut wrench is parallel to the torque wrench.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL TRANSMISSION OIL FILLER TUBE SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Coat a new O-ring with ATF, and install it to the oil filler tube.
Install the oil filler tube with the 2 bolts.
Install the oil level gauge.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL PROPELLER WITH CENTER BEARING SHAFT ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Install the propeller with center bearing shaft assembly (See page ).
Using a vernier caliper, measure the free length of the compression spring.
If the length is less than the minimum, replace the compression spring.
Install the front pipe to the pipe support.
Install a new gasket to the outlet pipe.

atten4.ptxt: Using a plastic-faced hammer, uniformly strike the gasket so that the gasket and exhaust pipe are properly fit.

item.ptxt: Be careful with the installation direction of the gasket.
To ensure a proper seal, do not use the front pipe to force the gasket onto the outlet pipe.

s2.ptxt: Install the front pipe with the 2 compression springs and 2 bolts. Alternately tighten the bolts in several passes.
Install the frame crossmember with the 4 bolts and 4 nuts.
Move the shift lever to N.
Remove the nut and disconnect the control cable.
Turn the control shaft lever clockwise until it stops, and then turn it counterclockwise 2 notches to set it to the N position.
While holding the control shaft lever slightly toward the R position side, connect the cable with the nut.

s-1.ptxt: CONNECT CABLE TO NEGATIVE BATTERY TERMINAL

atten3.ptxt: Certain systems need to be initialized after disconnecting and reconnecting the cable to the negative (-) battery terminal.

s2.ptxt: When moving the shift lever from P to R with the ignition switch to ON and the brake pedal depressed, make sure that the shift lever moves smoothly and correctly into position.
Start the engine and make sure that the vehicle moves forward after moving the shift lever from N to D, and moves in reverse after shifting to R.
If the results are not as specified, inspect the park/neutral position switch and check the shift lever.
Check the automatic transmission fluid level (See page ).
